def.dt: :a shrub (Camellia sinensis of the family Theaceae, the tea family) cultivated especially in China, Japan, and the East Indies

:the leaves, leaf buds, and internodes of the tea plant prepared and cured for the market, classed according to method of manufacture into one set of types (as green tea, black tea, or oolong), and graded according to leaf size into another (as orange pekoe, pekoe, or souchong)
:an aromatic beverage prepared from tea leaves by infusion with boiling water
:any of various plants somewhat resembling tea in properties
:an infusion of their leaves used medicinally or as a beverage
:tea rose
:refreshments usually including tea with sandwiches, crackers, or cookies served in late afternoon
:a reception, snack, or meal at which tea is served
:marijuana
:a bag usually of filter paper holding enough tea for an individual serving
:a perforated metal ball that holds tea leaves and is used in brewing tea in a pot or cup
:caddy
:a small flat cake usually made with raisins
:cookie
:tea wagon
:a dance held in the late afternoon
:a public garden where tea and light refreshments are served
:a tea plantation
:a semiformal gown of fine materials in graceful flowing lines worn especially for afternoon entertaining at home
:an afternoon social gathering at which tea is served
def.set: from the Boston Tea Party, name applied to the occasion in 1773 when a shipment of tea was thrown into Boston harbor in protest against the tax on imports
def.dt: :an exciting disturbance or proceeding
